chargeHist.descr: Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) (939.05 Party to a Crime)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher George Carter Atkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within 1 year of release from custody or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Huber privileges for treatment and school. Credit for 111 days time served.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher George Carter Atkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
As to the amended charge:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.      Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  


The Court sentenced the defendant to serve
 130 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 
111
days time served, Huber privileges for treatment and school.    

- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within 1 year of release from custody or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Christopher George Carter Atkins in court with attorney Mark G Lipscomb.  Defendant Christopher George Carter Atkins in custody.  Ann R Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Corr).    On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of Cocaine - PTAC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(c), 939.05, an unclassified misdemeanor.

Defendant Christopher George Carter Atkins in court with attorney Mark G Lipscomb.  Jacob D Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-27-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark G. Lipscomb in court, defendant Christopher George Carter Atkins not in court, in custody.  Jacob D. Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher George Carter Atkins in court with attorney Chris Lipscomb for Mark G. Lipscomb.  Defendant Christopher George Carter Atkins in custody.  Jacob D. Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Christopher George Carter Atkins in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Christopher George Carter Atkins in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
